description: Might've been fun, however crashes almost as soon as you start a game
Opensuse Krypton comes with this game by default. I installed it on my Leap because I like the clear, clean graphics and it's very configurable.
each time i try to launch a new game it's just crushes.
Was able to start a game. CPU opponent was able to make a move. My move comes up and game dies

It told me somewhere down the line it required ogg123, luckily i remember this as "Vorbis" which is a package that can be found in the Software Center. After this you can hear voice call-outs on moves and the game runs as you would expect. 

Three stars because the discard area isn't what you would expect, it jumbles the tiles and you quickly lose oversight. Suggest to have the discard tiles line up in a row. Tiles are also a bit small and somewhat hard to read. The game could use a graphic overhaul but does seem functional nonetheless.
was able to make it through one hand after about 10 crashes.   It crashed immediately after the second hand deal.

three stars for my previous installation on Zorin and it worked fine, had a great time, but I couldn't even find it on my KDE Neon for some reason, it just didn't appear in my application launcher. heck, I even couldn't find it in my terminal using "whereis" but I could get the info, very strange.
summary: could find it though I finished the installation

description: I sign in, and make a move then it dies
The game stops abruptly, I will change my rating when the game is playable without abrupt stop. For now I will uninstall it
自摸都不能赢？自摸都不能赢？自摸都不能赢？自摸都不能赢？自摸都不能赢？
